learnings.title: Database URL Consistency Between Services
learnings.summary: Both backend and auth services must use the same #removed-legacysecret. When using Cloud SQL proxy, the URL must use Unix socket format, not direct IP. Invalid IP addresses in secrets cause connection timeouts.

issue_discovery.symptom: Auth service fails with database connection timeout
issue_discovery.initial_assumption: Auth service was getting different #removed-legacythan backend
issue_discovery.actual_problem: Both services use same secret but IP address is invalid

discovery_method.step: Checked how both services load #removed-legacy- both use os.getenv("DATABASE_URL")
Checked Cloud Build configs - both use database-url-staging secret
Listed Cloud SQL instances - IP doesn't match any instance

database_secret_issue.problem: IP address 34.68.229.240 doesn't belong to any Cloud SQL instance

cloud_sql_proxy_configuration.required_url_format: Unix socket format for Cloud SQL proxy

unix_socket_format.description: When using Cloud SQL proxy, use Unix socket format
unix_socket_format.benefits: - Secure connection via Cloud SQL proxy - No need to manage SSL certificates - Automatic authentication via service account
unix_socket_format.ssl_handling: ALL SSL parameters (sslmode/ssl) must be removed for Unix socket connections

direct_ip_format.description: For direct connections without Cloud SQL proxy
direct_ip_format.requirements: - Valid IP address from actual Cloud SQL instance (34.132.142.103 is current) - SSL mode configuration (sslmode=require for psycopg2, converted to ssl=require for asyncpg) - Network access configured (authorized networks)

async_driver.tcp_connection: Convert sslmode=require to ssl=require (asyncpg doesn't understand sslmode)

conversion_flow.step1: GCP Secret Manager: stores with sslmode=require (standard format)

service_configuration_consistency.principle: All services must use the same database configuration approach

backend_service.should_use: Unix socket format if Cloud SQL proxy is configured

practice.title: Use Cloud SQL proxy for all services
practice.description: Configure all Cloud Run services with --set-cloudsql-instances. Use Unix socket format in #removed-legacyfor consistency.

practice.title: Validate database URLs before deployment
practice.description: Check that IP addresses match actual Cloud SQL instances. Verify Unix socket paths match configured Cloud SQL instances.

practice.title: Single source of truth for database configuration
practice.description: All services should use the same secret for DATABASE_URL. Update all services when changing database configuration.

practice.title: Document database instances
practice.description: Maintain clear documentation of all Cloud SQL instances. Include IP addresses, connection names, and purpose.

issue.check: Verify IP address matches an actual Cloud SQL instance
Confirm Cloud SQL proxy is running if using Unix socket
Check network connectivity and firewall rules
Verify username and password are correct
Check user exists in Cloud SQL instance
For asyncpg, use ssl= instead of sslmode=
Unix socket connections don't need SSL parameters

commands.command: echo -n "NEW_URL" | gcloud secrets versions add database-url-staging --data-file=- --project=netra-staging

action_items.action: Updated database-url-staging secret to use Unix socket format
Fixed backend service SSL parameter handling to match auth service pattern
Verify database credentials (password might be incorrect)
Redeploy backend service to use updated secret
Add Cloud SQL proxy configuration to backend service if missing
Create automated validation of database URLs in CI/CD
